intro: Rudgea reducticalyx, commonly known as the red-leaf rudgea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
